metadata.title: CVE-2016-0592 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component in OracleVirtualization VirtualBox before 4.3.36 and before 5.0.14 allows localusers to affect availability via unknown vectors related to Core.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-dkms - 4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-guest-source - 4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-guest-utils - 4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-qt - 4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
virtualbox-source - 4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.36-dfsg-1+deb8u1ubuntu1.14.04.1').
